result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel Andres Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit a DNA sample; pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- No possession of firearms.
- NO CONTACT with ALV and JSF.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with IC.

- Participate in counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Department.
- Anger Management Class and any recommended treatment.
- Mental Health Assessment and any recommended treatment if requested by the Agent.
- Pay restitution as ordered in 22CM555.

- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.
- Random UA's.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel Andres Ortiz in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Joel Andres Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant ordered to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to 22CM555, credit for 96 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- Participate in counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Department
- Random UA's.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- No possession of firearms.
- Anger management class and any recommended treatment
- Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment if requested by the Agent
- No contact with ALV and JSF
- No violent contact with IC
- Pay restitution as ordered in 22CM555
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.
Defense, filed.
State's Offer Letter, filed.
filed.

Defendant Joel Andres Ortiz not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Joel Andres Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense has received an offer and is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Joel Andres Ortiz not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel recently appointed and has received discovery and a offer and requests additional time to review.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed.
filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with J.F. or D.H.

Defendant Joel Andres Ortiz in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Joel Andres Ortiz in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joel Andres Ortiz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.F. or D.H.

Defendant Joel Andres Ortiz in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Joel Andres Ortiz in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joel Andres Ortiz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
